extra_fields.budget_breakdown: Cloud printer (SpacePrinter Lite, a cloud based SpacePrinter) 50k
extra_fields.challenges_or_risks: The primary risk in this deployment is finding the best balance of features for the lite version to ensure users can at least minimally function without dedicated hardware, but still encouraging users to upgrade to a hardware Spaceprinter for better results.
extra_fields.full_solution:
The Adosia team will design, build, and deploy a new cloud based Spaceprinter into the Adosia Marketplace. The minimum viable product for the marketplace was funded through Catalyst Fund 8. This improvement will provide a less complex onramp for manufacturers who participate in production for the marketplace.

 

The following features will be added to the core of the marketplace functionality:

 

Cloud printer (SpacePrinter Lite, a cloud based SpacePrinter). This module will allow users who do not own the hardware for a Spaceprinter, or who lack the technical expertise to network a hardware device, to still participate in providing production to the Adosia Decentralized Marketplace. The Lite printer will handle all smart contract interactions and allow the user to manually update each physical step along the way.

  


  


About Adosia Decentralized Marketplace

  


Adosia's decentralized fulfillment network is essentially composed of numerous smart contracts, including contracts for the marketplace, the printing pool, quality assurance, NFT role minting, 3d printer and shipping and receiving.

  


The smart contract associated with the 3D printable NFT marketplace will house user-submitted 3D printable NFTs which contain one or more .stl files along with any designer royalties referenced in the NFT metadata. The user will interact with the marketplace smart contract, selecting all the NFTs they would like to have printed, which will then create a new "purchase order" NFT capable of traversing the decentralized Adosia 3D printer operator network. Once a user holds a purchase order NFT, upon paying an appropriate fee, they will be able to initiate a print job for that NFT with the Adosia network. Upon successful print job completion the printer operator fulfilling the print job will be paid the majority of Ada with the appropriate 3D designer(s) being paid designated royalties. The Adosia smart contract will also earn a small fee for the Adosia treasury, with all participants being incentivized early on with Adosia ADO tokens.

  


Current Implementation

  


All on-chain functionality will be provided by the printing pool, purchase order, and printer registration contracts. These contracts will allow a customer to get a purchase order and have a registered printer accept the job for printing. The printer registration process has already started with the Adosia ambassador program.

  


What To Expect

  


Users will be able to buy an NFT of a purchase order that will allow them to choose to print one of our special designs via a registered space printer. The printer will then ship the 3D object to the user who will receive the object and confirm its quality. At this point, the purchase order will be returned to the user and the printer will be paid ADA for their services. It is a simple product but it shows what is technically possible now. Blockchain and the tangible world will mesh together and this is just a stepping stone along that path.
extra_fields.how_solution_address_challenge: This solution will address the challenge through the key metric of increased quality of existing products & integrations through suggested improvements that are supported by customer feedback or increased usage by the community. Integrating these features will position Adosia for more rapid market penetration.
extra_fields.new_proposal:
This proposal is a continuation of a few different proposals submitted by various team members.

  


In Fund 8 Adosia was successfully funded for the initial MVP of this marketplace and the CardanoBox system. https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405271

  


This proposal from Fund7 was a lightweight implementation of the model outlined under this proposal (not funded): https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/385120

  


This proposal submitted by Jia in Fund7 was funded, and provided the SpaceX engineers compensation to design all the rocket parts needed to execute a dynamic 3D printable rocket NFT drop: https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/383141 - The Adosia ambassador team is currently printing all rocket parts as we vigorously are iterating through tests to ensure Adosia delivers the highest quality design.

  


These proposals support facilitation of a parallel initiative to enable embedded IoT device integration and p2p relevant marketplaces for IoT device operating profiles:

  


https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/369922

  


https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/334417

  


This proposal enables an embedded library to create keys, sign transactions (or arbitrary data) and to verify message data for IoT device authentication. https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/324317
extra_fields.progress_metrics: The team will use a combination of git and trello to manage the project's progress. The project manager will prepare and submit the monthly reports to Catalyst with percent completed on the projects listed in this proposal. The Adosia team currently meets regularly six (6) times per week across various teams. We regularly track relevant action items, tasks, needs and progress and we adapt as necessary.
extra_fields.return_in_a_later_round: This project will be concluded at the end of this round and will not require additional funding. If we choose to develop additional features for the system in the future, we may request additional Catalyst funding.
extra_fields.sdg_rating:
SDG Goals

8 - Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

SDG Subgoals

8.2 - Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors

8.5 - By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value

8.6 - By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training

Key Performance Indicator (KPI)

8.2.1 - Annual growth rate of real GDP per employed person

8.5.1 - Average hourly earnings of employees, by sex, age, occupation and persons with disabilities

8.5.2 - Unemployment rate, by sex, age and persons with disabilities

8.6.1 - Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
extra_fields.team_details:
Kyle Solomon - CEO: An electrical engineer who began his career building and selling IoT and embedded systems at Intel. Kyle brings a wealth of business knowledge, technical savvy, and a passionate leadership drive to the team. Kyle is the creator of DripDropz, FROG Pool, Adosia, Spacecoins & JetChicken. 

  


Erik Anderson - Operations: Project Manager & Head Ambassador

  


With a background in Engineering and Manufacturing he provides the team with project management, innovation and design ideas. Currently, he is providing assistance in building the Adosia network and brand. He has been working with Kyle and Adosia for over ten years. He is an entrepreneur in spirit and a 3D printing enthusiast.

  


Ron Hill - Operations:Team Leader

  


His background is in industrial & systems engineering and quality management with 14 years of experience working in various manufacturing organizations both large and small. He is helping the Adosia team with product development testing, documentation, and aiding in ensuring this project is successful. He also is a core believer in utilizing decentralized systems for the benefit of the end users and participants in the network and committed to make this a reality with the Adosia team delivering on our mission. 

  


Aaron Lowry - Engineering: Hardware Integration

  


A builder and analyst with a broad background in IoT, construction, and blockchain network infrastructure. Aaron combines years of real-world digital product integration, manufacturing, and distribution experience with a passion for developing opportunities for end-users of decentralized networks.

  


Mark Stopka - Engineering: Technical Architect

  


Interim IT infrastructure Subject Matter Expert with overlap into Project Management, Program Management, IT Governance, IT Security and Business Development domains. He helps his clients with Transitions, Transformations, Service Development and other key initiatives where I deliver my broad cross-domain expertise. Within Adosia he is providing expertise and guidance to the team during the product development. 

  


Latheesan Kanesamoorthy - Full Stack Developer 

  


A senior software engineer and full stack developer. He has built many leading platforms in the Cardano space, including Tokhun's NFT minting and trading solution, Heidrun and the CIP-0027 royalty standard.

  


Quinn Parkinson - Lead Plutus and Smart Contract Developer: 

  


Quinn graduated from the first Plutus training program and has written a considerable number of successful Plutus smart contracts. A functional programmer with exceptional mathematical strengths, Quinn has been instrumental in the construction of impactful initiatives such as on-chain voting, multimillion dollar NFT marketplace contracts, vesting contracts and many others.

  


Lauris Stiglics - Operations

  


An entrepreneur with a background in IT project management. Lauris has been involved with Cardano since 2017 and has been an active member of the community ever since. Currently managing EU01 Stake Pool as well as providing technical support for other members of Cardano community, including helping them set up their own stake pools. He also was the Catalyst Circle Member (CC1 representing Stake Pool Operators) and funded proposer (Fund 8).

  


Caleb Hataj - Ambassador: 3D Printing Testing Lead

  


A Certified Journeyman Machinist of 7 years with a degree in Manufacturing Management, drafting, and product design. Caleb brings his experience as a CNC machinist and sales representative for made to order parts to Adosia, while being a discord manager and 3D printer operator in his spare time.

  


Siddik Adam - Engineering: Embedded IoT Engineer

  


A computer engineer with some experiences cutting across embedded, web & mobile, smart-contract development and machine learning, He brings his knowledge of web, smart-contract and embedded development to the team. He is also a core-dev in both Tokhun and DripDropz.

  


Kristen Bouwman - Ambassador 

  


Healthcare worker who is passionate about helping people attain their goals. Her aim is to support team members and users in the Adosia community. Kristen joined the Adosia team because she believes that the product and the team are making important contributions to the Cardano Community and to innovation in blockchain as the way forward.
extra_fields.timeline_and_key_milestones:
The Adosia development team will design, build, and implement this new feature to the Adosia marketplace in a 4 month timeframe. This will be developed and deployed by the team, and will be monitored. 

  


The Adosia team currently meets regularly six (6) times per week across various teams. We regularly track relevant action items, tasks, needs and progress and we adapt as necessary.

  


We keep target timelines and measure progress against those while regularly refactoring to account for unknown unknowns as they are revealed

proposal_relevant_experience: The Adosia team has a proven record of deploying highly successful projects on Cardano, including 1st Decentralized 3D Printing Marketplace. We are the team behind DripDropz, Tokhun, and funded proposals such as Heidrun.
proposal_solution: Provide a lite version of Spaceprinter that is fully cloud based, driving wider adoption.
proposal_summary: The current Spaceprinter requires additional hardware and network expertise that create barriers for some users.

extra_fields.budget_breakdown:
Backend development/hosting - $70k

We have been building our database of Twitter activity for about a year:

We prioritized cost for our first year, and we will have to upgrade our hosting scenario and database architecture in order to achieve scale.

* Scalable database architecture and hosting
* Relational
* time-series
* graph
* Social platform integrations - we focused our attention on Twitter first due to its friendly APIs, but the long term of our platform is to integrate as many social networks as possible to deliver visibility and control across these platforms
* Reddit
* Telegram
* Discord
* Youtube
* Instagram
* TikTok
* Data science and algorithm development/improvement
* AI/ML layers for predicting virality and authenticity
* Bot detection and auto-labelling
* Distributed data acquisition system -- allows any community member to be rewarded to passively contribute to data acquisition from social platforms
* Distributed compute system -- allow stake pool operators to run nodes which facilitate compute of virality and authenticity algorithms as well as host real-time streams and audit data for rewards

  


Front-end development: $40k

* Chrome extension to overlay over social media experience
* UI/UX for 4 dApps
* Staking - stake tokens to earn 2.5% of all platform transactions
* Curating - label and tag data for rewards based on stake
* Auditing - generate and own audits that will be of highest value to business users
* Brokering - host real-time maps and participate in distributed calculation of Mainline algos
* User testing

  


Smart contract development: $60k

* Data marketplace - smart contracts that power the Audit and Broker dApps
* Curation rewards - manage curation rewards and prevent gaming of the system
* Staking rewards - tie in with our billing system to automatically reward staking pool with 2.5% transaction rewards
* Data brokers - installs node software, manages participation settings, and allows for new real-time map creation

  


Marketing and community development: $30k

* User acquisition initiatives
* Partnership opportunities with other projects
* Community growth and management
extra_fields.challenges_or_risks:
The biggest risk is the bear market creating an unsuitable environment for a token launch. We are mitigating this risk by delivering value to blockchain projects, crypto-specific VCs, as well as non-crypto businesses in order to build a sustainable community that leverages the platform to grow their businesses. By proving the business use cases/value of the platform, we thus prove the value of the token ecosystem as described in this application and included documents.

  


Another risk is platform APIs -- at some level, much of our system is at the mercy of API policies which are subject to change. We mitigate this risk in the long term by supporting integrations to many different platforms as well as having several methods of still accessing certain data by scraping.
extra_fields.full_solution:
The Mainline platform (https://getmainline.io/platform) is an intelligence tool to help us figure out what's real on social. It uncovers the authenticity of influencers and projects, and find what's going viral before it gets huge. With it, the community can see beyond the algorithms and echo-chambers to know what's really going on in social media.

  


The platform is built and operated by the Mainline DAO (https://getmainline.io/) which is driven by the $MAIN token that allows holders to earn from social data that businesses use to make key decisions on where they invest their resources, as well as reward mechanisms to help collect, process & curate data. As a DAO, we also have a governance model that allows the community to prioritize features and get rewarded to participate in their development.

  


The Mainline platform is currently live and in open alpha. You can make an account here (https://app.getmainline.com/) to get a sense for what we're building.

  


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Primitives of the Mainline platform: 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Real-time streams of topics across multiple social networks visualized as a network graph-- called conversation maps-- that delivers a god-mode view for the ongoing conversations. Identify the people, topics, and trends that are driving engagement. Here's the map on Cardano from today (https://app.getmainline.com/user/cardano).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Profile pages on users, posts, hashtags, links, and media where authenticity, engagement, activity, and influence audits are requested and consumed. Browse through the top followers and engagers to get a sense for who and what is real. Use these pages to do due diligence of projects, influencers, or even yourself and your own account. Here's the Cardano profile page (https://app.getmainline.com/user/cardano). Sign up at the top right to see your own profile page.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Leaderboard pages on users, hashtags, posts, links, and media to rank by overall influence, engagement quality, and activity. Projects use these to find influencers or partners and top emerging conversations, VCs and retail investors use these to find quality projects:

  


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mainline Algos

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We've developed a set of algos that provide visibility of both what's going viral as well as who and what are most authentic:

* Virality detection -- using a variety of network graph math and engagement numbers to find conversations and users that are emerging as viral
* Influence scoring -- algos that see through large follower counts for those users that have the ear of high value people
* Engagement quality scoring -- algos that see through huge engagement numbers to find the accounts and posts that are getting authentic engagement

  


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mainline DAO and token ecosystem: 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The DAO uses the $MAIN token to drive collection of the most valuable data, process and contextualize it as quickly as possible, offer a free tier that doesn’t require ads, and eventually create a sustainable ecosystem not reliant on centralized infrastructure. 

prioritize collection | distribute compute | incentivize human intelligence | decentralize benefit

  


*Prioritize collection - Speculator market - Auditors and Brokers*

Mainline doesn’t just search social networks– it collects, connects, analyzes, and stores it too. This gets costly really fast, and there’s A LOT of data on social networks– for example just on twitter there’s over hundreds of millions of users generating around 500M tweets per day. How do we prioritize the data we collect? We use the token to introduce market forces to this process– incentivizing holders to accurately predict which topics and trends will attract and be of most interest to paid users of the platform. Brokers speculate on which topic streams will be accessed most, while auditors predict which users and activity will be most important to verify. The latter drives collection of user objects across social, the former of posts. 

  


In our open alpha to date, we have collected over 600gb of social data:

* 400,000,000+ users
* 158,000,000+ posts
* 20,000,000+ media
* 9,000,000+ links
* 2,000,000+ hashtags
* 260,000,000+ time series data points
* Billions of interactions

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*HUMINT - Curators*

Machine learning and AI is great at a lot of things, but at present misses important nuances. We incentivize community verifying, labeling and categorizing in MAIN, using a reward multiplier based on quantity and quality of curation. Curation activities include reCAPTCHA-like widgets and tagging users and posts for sentiment, quality, predictions, and more. Anyone can tag elements in the system in the Search and Feed tabs, but only stakers are eligible for Curator rewards. Stake any amount to access the Curator tab and tag to earn. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Distributed data collection and processing - from passive contribution to node operation*

Data collection is distributed, with rewards in MAIN to contribute to the process– in the beginning, opting in allows the network to make authenticated API requests on your behalf to process authenticity audits more quickly for everyone. In the future, a master node architecture will fully decentralize data streaming, parsing, analysis, and storage. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Decentralized benefits - Everyone*

Social media platforms have dramatic expectations for growth and are really expensive to run, and are invariably forced into the ad-model to underwrite their sustainability. Unfortunately, the ad-model has led to the complete degradation of digital interactions by incentivizing manufactured divisiveness, the proliferation of shills and bots, and the amplification of the most outrageous. 

  


Social media can be blamed for social polarization, covid disinformation, and the near complete breakdown of political discourse. But it’s also connected and organized the citizenry of the world in profound ways to check the balance of power– from r/wallstreetbets shining light on a rigged system (and making lots of tendies in the process) to global groundswell of support that pressured governments to support Ukraine. 

  


We’re not turning back from the connectedness these platforms deliver. And we’re not likely to have a viable alternatives to the OG behemoths– it’s where we already spend our time and have crafted our personas for much of our lives. 

  


Mainline isn’t a social network, and doesn’t aim to replace or compete with existing platforms– it’s aim is to deliver x-ray vision of activity across many social networks, providing a layer of control and visibility where anyone who uses these social platforms can benefit. 

  


The data collection and curation driven by the MAIN token builds a massive community-owned database that supports an ongoing free tier including a chrome extension that anyone can use to better navigate social media and break out of the algorithms and echo-chambers.
extra_fields.how_solution_address_challenge:
The blockchain industry has weathered many dangerous storms so far, but the sustainability of the industry is contingent on real-world use cases that provide undeniable value not only to crypto-natives, but also to outside businesses and regular people.

  


We believe our project marries a solution to many of the problems of social media with the fundamental aspects of web3 -- visibility, governance, and incentivized participation in a way that can cement Cardano as a chain with high value projects that solve real-world problems.
extra_fields.progress_metrics:
* Overall platform metrics:
* New platform signups
* Daily active users
* Specific feature use:
* Number of audits requested/consumed/shared
* Number of leaderboards built/shared
* Daily usage of conversation maps
extra_fields.return_in_a_later_round:
Likely yes. We see tremendous benefit with our platform for the Cardano ecosystem and community and the opportunity to build out our system to support Cardano if the community will have us.

  


Our platform is highly extensible and has the potential for a large number of modules that can benefit both projects of all kinds as well as the ordinary Cardano community members.

Preston Tesvich - algo development, backend design, product management

Chris Berger - marketplace and rewards dApp design, ecosystem partnerships, new user growth

Brandon Berger - full-stack dev and sys admin

Jessica McCann - UI/UX, creative director

Ben Meredith - token ecosystem consulting, smart contract development

Fran Waldecker - community management, marketing, project management

We are looking for Plutus/haskell devs that can consult and build out parts of our dApps
extra_fields.timeline_and_key_milestones:
Q2 2021: 3x oversubscribed in our seed round

Q3 2021: private beta with select crypto marketing firms and influencers

  


Q4 2021 to Now -- open alpha for Mainline platform allows users to access real-time conversation maps and authenticity/engagement audits. Go make an account here and check it out: https://app.getmainline.com/

  


Q3 2022:

* Launch chrome extension -- allows anyone in the community to overlay virality and authenticity data on top of their social media experience. Creates a viral component to our marketing to attract both crypto and non-crypto users.
* Launch paid platform features -- we will launch with the ability for the community to run their own audits, create custom conversation maps, and create custom influence leaderboards for projects shopping for influencers, capital firms shopping for projects, and retail investors to perform due diligence. Payment will be accepted in both fiat and crypto. As we launch the token and associated dApps, the community will be able to share in that revenue by participating in data curation and the generation of data assets such as authenticity/engagement audits and real-time maps.
* Staking dApp -- community members can stake to earn 2.5% of all platform transactions (incl. fiat payments)
* Curation dApp -- community members can help label data for rewards based on their stake

  


Q4 2022:

* Data marketplace dApp -- creates a data speculation market where token holders can create and acquire a variety of data assets and earn whenever paid users access them. This allows the community to earn on social data as well as prioritize which data the system collects
* DAO governance -- make public our backlog and open up for community voting to prioritize development as well as get involved/rewarded to help build out what the community decides is important.

  


Q1 2023:

* Data broker dApp -- allows node operators to host the Mainline system and get rewarded to host real-time conversation maps, process audits, and participate in distributed compute for Mainline algos.

proposal_relevant_experience: Over the past year, our team of 6 have built the Mainline platform which is now in open alpha. We are an experienced team of startup junkies & crypto degens that were fed up with the problems created by social media and saw an opportunity to make an impact using Web3.
proposal_solution: Mainline is x-ray vision for social media, allowing the community to see through bogus vanity metrics, capitalize on organic virality, and participate in governance, curation, and a data marketplace.
proposal_summary: Social media is broken. There is no transparency or ownership over our own data, leaving us at the mercy of nefarious actors and productized for someone else's gain.

extra_fields.challenges_or_risks:
A lack of interest from projects to engage in exploring and considering Cardano as a viable blockchain to launch on.

  


We plan to address any such concerns or reservations that creators might have by approaching them, and generally the issue, in an authentic, honest and relatable way. By simply presenting that we too are artists and creators, who have found success on Cardano, the way we have achieved that success and that there is a long list of reasons why we see Cardano as being a superior platform in the long run.

  


Unlike other similar projects, we won’t have hidden agendas when consulting artists. For instance, we won’t be trying to onboard them to our specific marketplace. We’ll relate artist to artist.
extra_fields.full_solution:
The planned solution has two components and deliverables.

  


1. A series of guides featuring rich interactive infographics and text.
2. On-demand, in-person, one on one consultancy sessions with NFT project creators and developers (to be conducted over video calls).

  


From experience, we have found that this is by far the most effective way to attract & onboard.

  


The sessions will be 2 hours in length each, and cover a range of topics, starting from subjects from the guides, but adapting and evolving them according to the needs of each project.

  


Over the course of the last year, we have already offered consultancy sessions to artists and projects, either preparing to launch on Cardano or entirely new to the ecosystem, successfully onboarding them.

  


The role of the guides that we plan to produce in tandem with the consultancy sessions is twofold:

  


1. As support materials that expand on the information the consultancy sessions will offer.
2. Serve as a marketing and promotional material to attract and onboard new projects to Cardano.

  


  


Just a few examples of subjects and themes to be covered by the guides:

  


* The fact that on Cardano NFTs are actual native tokens, which live on the blockchain at the same level as ADA, not in a smart contract that can be exploited, as we have seen happen repeatedly.
* The low energy consumption of the Cardano blockchain, which thus has a very low carbon footprint, making it much more environmentally friendly
* The incredibly low minting costs.
* The very low transaction fees.
* The fact that, unlike ETH, Cardano does not experience failed transactions - worst case a tx results in a refund which requires minimal transaction fees.
* The vibrant and helpful developer community that can assist with technical problems if they were to emerge.
* The friendly and supportive nature of a large part of the Cardano NFT community.
* The huge potential for growth of the entire Cardano ecosystem, when compared to ETH. Becoming a part of the ecosystem now will almost surely make you an early adopter.
* The spirit of innovation and pioneering of the entire Cardano ecosystem that is also manifested in the NFT space.
* And many more.

  


The consultancy sessions will be on-demand and free of charge for interested projects. Each project will be able to book up to a maximum of 5 sessions over the course of its development.

  


We expect, on average, each project to book 2-3 sessions, our aim is to offer consultancy to 20-25 projects.
extra_fields.how_solution_address_challenge:
Our solution addresses the challenge’s definition of success directly: 

  


*Projects who were either planning to or did launch on an EVM-based blockchain deploy in the Cardano ecosystem and can do so easily.*

  


This is exactly what our main objective is with this proposal.

  


Our main focus will be on trying to attract yet unreleased, in development projects from ETH to Cardano. However, this will not mean that they will be our only target audience. As part of the initiative, we will also look to present the advantages of Cardano to already existent projects in the hopes that they will either look into bridging their existing NFT projects to Cardano when that becomes a technical possibility or choose to launch upcoming projects, spin-offs, or sequels on Cardano. (Imagine “BAYC 2” or “Punks Extended” on Cardano).
extra_fields.new_proposal:
The Fund 8 version of this proposal was ranked third in the F8: The Great Migration (from Ethereum) challenge by CAs, with 7 CAs awarding it an average score of 4.62.

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/399093 

  


The proposal was also highly approved by voters, an overwhelming majority of wallets that voted on the proposal, voted for it. Unfortunately the proposal missed being funded because of being slightly over the category budget (the first not to be funded).

  


This is a resubmission of the proposal, adjusted for Fund 9.
extra_fields.progress_metrics:
We will be measuring 3 main KPIs for the project:

  


* Number of visits to the online guides.
* Number of 1 to 1, in person consultancy/mentoring sessions held.
* Number of projects onboarded to Cardano that migrated from EVM based blockchains.

  


Each deliverable, as detailed above will be recorded and submitted via the Catalyst Monthly Reporting form.
extra_fields.return_in_a_later_round: If the project is successful and produces the desired results, we may return to Catalyst to fund more consultancy sessions.
extra_fields.team_details:
Award-winning filmmakers, film and animation directors, app and game developers.

In 2021 they moved into the web3 economy granting new life to one of their projects in the form of an NFT collection on Cardano.

  


Anamaria Kövesdi

https://www.linkedin.com/in/anamaria-k%C3%B6vesdi-354649106/ 

  


Rares Kövesdi

https://www.linkedin.com/in/rares-k%C3%B6vesdi-551260106/ 

  


There is an entire range of reasons why we think that we are uniquely qualified to execute this project, support and onboard NFT projects and creators to Cardano:

  


* We have been exposed to all aspects of the NFT ecosystem on Cardano since before day 1 (March 1, 2021 - The Mary Hardfork).
* As artists and creators, we have launched two Cardano NFT projects: Trybbles, in May 2021, and Icons in September 2021. https://www.trybbles.com + https://www.newmindflow.com/works/icons
* Authors of the first NFT launch on Cardano with a functional, compilable, smart contract in the metadata of the token, completely on-chain in collaboration with Quinn ( @mqp ), aka. TheAncientKraken. An NFT from the collection was the first one to be sold through a smart contract, minutes after the Alonzo HFC. It also was the first sale through a smart contract on Cardano to pay residuals (i.e. royalties) to artists on resales of their works. https://cardanoscan.io/transaction/34dd0b7ae56b65f4cda029d99cda8322684ec6339ac1c195c16458c1e5e94b96?tab=contracts
* We are Fibo Genesis Artists and have unveiled our third Cardano NFT collection, with the launch of the Genesis Collection of the Emurgo marketplace, Fibo https://fibo.art/collection/21
* Core members of the Cardano NFT Guild since January 2022.
* Over the course of the last year, we have already offered consultancy sessions to artists and projects, either preparing to launch on Cardano or entirely new to the NFT ecosystem.
* As members of NFT-DAO (between late February - early June 2021), we have worked on trying to build a fair and open ecosystem for NFTs on Cardano.
* We have participated in a wide range of aspects of the Cardano ecosystem. For example, we have been involved with Project Catalyst since Fund 3, February 2021 in all roles.
* Member of multiple “gated access” communities in the Cardano NFT space.

  


As a result of all these factors and events, we have amassed a considerable amount of knowledge and experience about the Cardano NFT space, and the NFT ecosystem in general, which we are now ready to pass on and help attract and onboard new artists and projects from ETH to Cardano.

  


As mentioned we are core members of the NFT Guild ( https://www.nft-guild.io ), please consider checking out the guild’s other proposals:

  


NFT Community & Ecosystem (Fund 10 Challenge Setting)

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/417910

  


NFT Swap Infrastructure Templates 2 (F9: Dapps, Products and Integrations)

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/417999
extra_fields.timeline_and_key_milestones:
We plan to start work on the project shortly after successful funding. 

Creating the guides and the initial marketing phase will take about a month, a month and a half.

It’s impossible to predict with accuracy the timeframe over which the consultancy sessions will take place, given their on-demand nature, but our estimate is between 2-3 months.

  


The implementation plan is as follows:

  


1. Market Research
2. Guides Drafting
3. Guides Design
4. Guides Publishing
5. Marketing
6. Consultancy Sessions (on-demand)
7. Results Analysis
8. Analysis Compiling and Publishing
9. Presentation and Marketing of Successful Results

  


Deliverables for other Fund 9 and previous funds proposals.

  


Fund 9:

  


We are the project managers and market researchers for Phase 2 of the *NFT Swap Infrastructure Templates* project https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/417999.

As estimated in the detailed plan for that project, we foresee our commitment to be of around 12hrs/week/person for the duration of the project, including Phase 1, which we estimate to complete by the end of 2022. As such if this project is funded there will only be a partial overlap.

  


NFT Film Distribution Dapp & Showcase

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/421355

If funded we will take on a project management and oversight role in the initiative and conduct the hiring process.

We estimate a required commitment of 5-7hrs/week/person.

  


Trybbles NFT AR Pets project divided into 3 proposals.

  


Prototyping & Tokenomics

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/422707  

World Building - Art & Assets

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/422762 

Development

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/422724

If funded we will take on a project management and oversight role in the initiative and conduct the hiring process.

We estimate a required commitment of 10hrs/week/person.

  


If all the projects that we have applied for in Fund 9 get funded, the timeframes for the other projects will only partially overlap with this project. We estimate the time commitment for the other projects for the periods of overlap to be around 25hrs/week/person, giving us ample time to execute on the deliverables of this project.

  


Previous Funds:

  


As core members of the NFT Guild we are involved in finalising the deliverables for the NFT Guild Fund 7 proposal https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/NFT-Alliance/384031-48088 . However this will have very little impact on our ability to deliver on this project, as the scope of the proposal is complete and the only deliverable left is the project close-out report.

  


The NFT Guild has several standards proposals funded in F8:

  


NFT-Guild: Standard for verification of NFTs

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398372

  


NFT-Guild: NFT Royalty Standards

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/400204

  


The workload associated with the deliverables of these projects is distributed amongst the members of the NFT guild, and the time commitment required for us is of just several hours/week.

  


We are also the project managers and market researchers of the *NFT Swap Infrastructure Templates* project, the first phase of which was funded in Catalyst Fund 8 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/397532 .

Involved in Project Catalyst since F3.

Members of various Cardano initiatives & communities.

proposal_solution: One-on-one consultancy & onboarding sessions for new & in-development ETH NFT projects supported by a series of comprehensive & appealing visual guides.
proposal_summary: How do we get the interest of artists & developers planning to release NFT projects on ETH and onboard them smoothly to Cardano?

extra_fields.budget_breakdown:
SDA uses a 50$/hour co-production rate.  

  


Check our SDA Budget/Roadmap spreadsheet for a precise overview. 

  


Stage A & B - Workshop & Instructional material production

Budget: 308 hours x 50$ = $15400

  


Stage C - Design Culture

Budget: 60 hours x 50$ = $3000

  


Stage D - SDA Live classes / Workshops

Budget: 204 hours = $10200

  


Stage E - Social Design Instructors - The Future of UX

Budget: 150 hours x 50$ = $7500

  


Stage F - SDA Presentation

Budget: 64 hours x 50$ = #3200

  


Stage G - SDA Website

Budget: 182 hours x 50$ = 9100

  


TOTAL BUDGET REQUEST: $48400
extra_fields.challenges_or_risks:
Risk - Coaching SDA Instructor to boost our reach.

  


As you can see in the budget [Reference 2 - See our budget/roadmap and program spreadsheet. the more significant chunk of money is for Live-classes and to coach UX 3.0 instructors, as we don't currently have the man/women power to fine-tune the educational project *and* tailor directly to external clients. 

 

 We mitigate this risk by co-designing these materials to onboard more people in our co-production team and coach SDA instructors, enabling us to have outreach potential.

 

 In the future, we want to create education as a service license. Together with Social app revenue, we fund a professional-grade curriculum for our youth and provide the accompanying Social Technology Stack for Digital Conversations. 

  


Risk - A new way to approach user interaction.

  


 Because of the new nature of Story-based Chat Assistants, we need specific knowledge and Motion UI front-end skill. Because Conversational Interaction Design is a new front-end UI approach for Blockchain, but re-imagining pages into conversations simplifies things considerably, because the dependencies are less complex.

  


 We coordinate with production partners and use our Social R&D tools to learn and build together using the user experience perspective. We are taking away risks because many eyes, expertise, passion, and way of working come together in our Live classes.

 

 By co-designing with our Partners, the Catalyst, Cardano, and Broader communities, we incorporate honest feedback captured in social design sessions, fine-tuning the design tools and instructional materials even further.

  



> The best way to learn is to teach and iterate. We consider social design a peer review method for iterative UI design, removing the churn we experience in Catalyst today.

  


 Risk - Lack of research / live class participants

In web2 it's often hard to find research candidates or participants, but the web3 community is earger to learn, participate and provide feedback. 

  


We concur with the finding of Oliver/IOHK, especially #2 about finding participants.

  


"The community is supercharged! There’s no shortage of interest to gain #UX insight. I used to struggle finding users willing to participate in feedback but in web3 it’s the opposite. We even actively test analysis methods to gain insight from the sheer volume of feedback." -OE

  


We also have low to no cost to find participants because of cross-promotion in Discord and partner servers. Growth is also not our key driver at the moment, small groups that can use and provide feedback on our materials is really valuable at this stage, and people can learn new UX3.0 approaches in return.
extra_fields.full_solution:
[reference 1 - Meaningful Brands - 12 year study]

Slide:19, sum of personal (32%) and collective (29%) benefit percentages.

Source: Havas Group, n=350K+

  


1 - How you perceive the problem you are solving

  


Introduction

This proposal seeks your investment to launch the Social Design Academy and start helping communities and brands become a force for good using UX3.0 training.

  


We close the gap between web2 and web3 by designing digital conversations instead of pages, creating a social layer across legacy systems and Cardano.

 

Blockchain gives us a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to design Software for the people by the people. But our current wallet software separates utility and education, creating barriers for people to enter and trust the crypto space and partake in meaningful use cases.

 

Catalyst has its challenges. To effectively work with people you might never have met before, and break out of discovery talks only, we need a new approach to our way of working. 

 

We need a new social design approach turns everybody into a designer, unlocking the power of our human potential through cognitive diversity.

  


  


 New UX 3.0 method & Social Design Instructors

  


Last few years, I designed new Social UX tools that brought me closer to the vision of developing Software that has positive impacts on our daily lives. But I must admit, I have been trying to put this on the Catalyst agenda since Fund2 and resources are running low. Rethinking systems using Design Research takes a lot of time and packaging these outcomes for a larger audience are two different things. That why I ask for your investment to launch the Social Design Academy.

 

To assist people in their Cardano journey, we must upgrade how our Communities and Brands interact with their audiences & clients. We must elevate the repetitive, harsh, static page-based Software using UX 3.0 in which we transition from 'Designing for convenience' to 'Designing for wellbeing' using engaging digital storytelling. Humane software asks people what they need instead of telling them what to do. At Social Design Academy, we are mindful of what we build with Blockchain in our social live classes.

  


"Together, we design a new category of Social Apps that deliver personal and collective development goals using Story-based Chat Assistants. " - NK.

  


  


  


With your investment, Social Design Academy launches a new UX3.0 program that turns communities & brands into forces for good. [Check our SDA budget and roadmap]

  


Let's discover these new perspectives together.

  



> 2 - Your reasons for approaching it in the way that you have;

Most of us have seen the slide in Catalyst Townhall once or twice; "Catalyst disorients, overloads, and inspires." The decentralized nature of the space causes adverse effects, mainly because people don't know where to start or progress, often reaching out to family, friends & Social Media for help.

  

\*\*The Functional/ Strategy Perspective\*

  


 Page-based interaction design for the web is getting old; we need to rethink the front-end UI for Blockchain to unleash its full potential. Why? Pages are passive and reactive; they don't pro-actively inspire and encourage people to join the Cardano ecosystem.  

 

Social Design Academy focuses on distributed software design (we also call it real social software). Redefining how we build distributed software doesn't happen overnight and needs some serious unlearning and relearning, we develop and streamline what and how we make by capturing design research, having live classes and re-imagening what software can do for us as humans.

 

Social Design Academy believes in coordinating live classes and workshops around distributed software that compounds in a Conversational UI Toolkit leveraging bright minds in the Catalyst, Cardano, and broader software development space. 

 

 By rethinking how we design and develop our front-end and node-systems together, we can not only create a bridge between our web2 and web3 worlds; we make the web fun and meaningful again. By using moral imagination, we deliver true social impact. 🔥  

 

Everybody can join collaborative our design workshops, we turn people into civilian design thinkers and doers.

  



> 3 - Who your project will engage, or who its stakeholders are;

Social Design Academy is already engaging with the Catalyst & Cardano community daily in our Discord and by having weekly live classes that use these new design tools like; UX reviews, Pain & Gain Personas & Experience mapping. And from July '22 forward we want to intensify our online events.

  


 Niels Kijf is Social UX Advisor for Consenz and provides the Cardano ecosystem with new design tools to find product-market-fit, of which Emotion Mapping and Pain & Gain are the most effective. Design with emotion, not for emotion, is a core Social Design Principle and simplifies how we connect with our audiences. 

  


  


  


In our latest workshop, we concluded that the new Ideascale proposal template triggers anxiety and stress—[Reference 6 - Emotion mapping] Our Proposal Assistant will be an iterative design research to show novel proposal writing processes using the distributed collaboration mindset. [Reference 7 - Design research Chat Assistant for Cardano].

  


 'If you don't design with your customer, you are not designing for your customer.'

  


 To boost our outreach, we coach Social Design Instructors that using Social R&D tools within communities & brands co-create experience maps [Reference 8 - XP map example] that are self-explanatory, stress-free, and meaningful. Together we unlock the true potential of Cardano using our new Social Design tools and Story-based Chat Assistant techniques. 

  



> 4 - How will your project be implemented?

  


Visualise to Realise; We can do it!

  


Catalyst is missing Iterative Design Circles, UI design groups that engage and encourage blockchain communities with mockups, fresh ideas, and directions by showing UI designs for Digital Governance solutions. Using modern design tools, we get people excited about design, and by asking for feedback on social media, we show people potential directions. 

  

In my almost 25 years of experience as a Digital product designer, people get excited when you show potential approaches and directions in UI design mockups. 

  

People become creative, asking questions like: "Is this also possible? Did you think about this?" This shift the mindset from seeing obstacles to creating a yes-and environment for future design iterations.

  

We train social UX basics in our live classes [Reference 9 - RSVP Channel] and excite people through loom recordings discussing design. We democratize and humanize our software design, a mission with only winners. [Reference 10 - De-colonize Design thinking.pdf]

  

Social Design Academy wants to step into the Civilian Design Space using the following Japanese proverb;

  

  Tell people, and they Forget,

  Show people, and they Remember,

  Involve people, and they will Understand.

  



> 5a - What you will produce (i.e., your outputs)

  


Monetize Digital Storytelling

  


By co-designing UX 3.0, together with the Social Design Academy Pitch/Co-investor deck, we engage with Communities & Brands with a new Social Appstore concept. Monetizing Digital Storytelling in new Social Apps outside of the walled gardens will drive adoption for the Cardano Ecosystem, as our world is in desperate need of new hope narratives.

 

Our Proposal Assistant will be used as example project in our Live classes. From September onwards we will bring these topics to our live-classes and partners, while I button up F6: In-wallet Onboarding for ADAholder, before Sept 1st, 2022. Learning and building together is our core philosophy, as we believe unlearning and relearning in groups work best.

  


We make Communities & Brands Blockchain Ready™ by introducing a new way of developing their business client interactions using Story Based Chat Assistants. Instead of social media creating our world views, we are transforming our phones into remote controls for our reality. 

  


 Doesn't that sound refreshing?

  

For our complete approach, check our Budgets, Milestones, and design program, see our SDA budget/roadmap and program spreadsheet.

  


  


  

Production Overview

  


 Stage A & B - Social UX & Digital Storytelling Workshop | Gitbook Instructional Materials WIP

  


  Through Social R&D, we are co-producing two workshops: Social UX & Conversational Interaction Design that redefine how we ideate and co-design real social Software using our distributed software mindset. These workshops use Miro boards & Discord as communication tools. [Reference - Levels of participation.]

  


Stage C - Design Culture & Governance

Miro template board.

  


We will create a social design tool, governance schematic, and personal & collective development goal worksheet.

  


1. Asses your current design culture by by placing your heart in the Triangles of Trut
2. There is more to governance than voting; Co-creation as governanc
3. We create new worksheets that help set up personal and collective development goal

  


Stage D - SDA Live classes / Workshops | Gitbook Live classes WIP

  


 We guide and train communities and brands to develop mesmerizing Social Apps that boost personal and community development goals. We believe looking inwards and outwards is the answer to true social impat, because system change is a responsibility of us all. D1 - Has a focus on Proposal Assistant (Inward focus) and D2 focus outwards on Social Apps for communities (outward focus.

  


Stage E - Social R&D - The Future of UX | Gitbook WIP: Social R&D | Design research documentation

  


 We believe in the power of collective genius, and by training SDA instructors, we can scale our new software design approach within the Catalyst, Cardano, and broader software design communities. By logging our findings in our Design research documentation, we create one source of truth for our Social Design Academy members. 

  


Stage F - SDA Presentation Miro Board | Gitbook WIP

  


 Upon completing the instructional materials, we need to create a concise SDA Pitch that promotes UX3.0, resulting in new Use Cases through Digital Storytelling on Cardano. A sponsor/co-investor deck [Rough version here] already has a ton of community feedback; master to reduce (Remove 50%) turns this material into a solid Pitch deck.

  


  

  


Stage G - SDA Website Project Website | Client website (In development) | Gitbook WIP

  


The last part is bringing all this together by upgrading our current project-based website, into a personal / brand-facing website, with pages for our core tools, solutions, and services, making Social Design Academy ready for launch in March'23. (Not not worry, we give live lessons all to way there.)

  


  



> 5b - What will happen as a result of your work (i.e., your outcomes).

Our workshops and instructional training enable communities and brands to compound true social impact through Digital Storytelling, resulting in a new category of humane Software.

  

 The outcome of our work;

  


1. We help Communities & Brands define their personal and collective development goals, giving them more clarity on their Social Impact and helping them attract people into their communities.
2. Our Conversational Interaction Design approach has created a novel way for Communities & Brands to engage with their audiences by developing new Social App
3. By co-designing a Conversational UI Toolkit, we redirect our energy from software delivery to value deliver
4. We promote brands that are in the process of becoming a force for goo
5. By creating the Conversational UI Toolkit with partners\*, we want to leverage what we can build on the Cardano blockchain.

  


\* We are currently talking with LITTLEFISH, ADAO, HANDSHAKE, and KONMA as production partners for this Cardano UI Toolkit. We hope other communities join us in this exciting digital storytelling journey, making Cardano streetwise and the Social Impact chain of choice.

  



> 6 - Explain who will benefit.

 The delivery of this project benefits the Catalyst, Cardano, and broader software development communities as we venture into the world to create a bridge between our web2 and web3 world using a humane software design approach. 

  


 'Together we stand, Divided we fall.'
extra_fields.how_solution_address_challenge:
Social Design Academy addresses the Dapps, Products & Integrations Challenge because:

  


1. We see a strong alignment with Cardano's and Social Design Academy's mission: "Build Together" & "Future Realities Today," as we both want to be a force for good, driving meaningful use cases and adoption.
2. By training individuals and meaningful brands in building personal and collective development goals in game-like Social Apps, we drive adaption through education.
3. Our Exercises make it easier for self-steering groups to drive adoption by effectively working together.

  


Charles pointed out that UX is the biggest Onboarding driver for Catalyst/Cardano in his keynote for Fund9.

  


Challenge link for quick access:

https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/campaigns/26595/about
extra_fields.new_proposal:
Yes, this proposal is related to F6: In-wallet onboarding for ADAholders, but not a continuation.

  


The focus of the F6 proposal is design research how to make Cardano ready for family and friends using a chat-like interface.

  


This proposal focuses on putting a solid foundation in place for the launch of Social Design Academy itself.

extra_fields.return_in_a_later_round:
Funding this proposal will create a solid foundation for the Social Design Academy as unlearning / relearning platform. By coaching instructors, we make a positivity virus that helps people and communities build humane and pleasant Software.

  


If we return for funding it will be to attract more developers around the Social Technology stack, because the foundation is in place. 

  


So yes, we probably will have to return to Catalyst, but we do so with good intent for people and our planet.
extra_fields.team_details:
Co-production Team

The main objective of this proposal is putting a solid educational foundation and instructional materials in place, and create materials for outreach. We will put a co-production pipeline in place, in which I (Niels) takes lead, and the co-production team and other social design layers can really help make the materials better. Create, Use, Tune is our mindset.

  


  

Niels Kijf - Founder of Social Design Academy 

*Responsibilities: Niels - UX 3.0 Instruction | Exercise/Workflow Design | UX&UI Design | Partner Outreach*

  


Niels (Master Digital Media Design, Oxford) is a social technology innovator. He started the Social Design Academy to deliver UX 3.0 education. Our current software design is still targeting the individual, yet web3 is designing shared experiences for groups, a fresh new field that needs a new educational program and technology stack. Leveling up UX into Social UX is one of the SDA missions for 2022 and beyond.

Portfolio | Linkedin

  


Harsha Gullapalli - UI/UX designer, Digital Storyteller & Educator 

*Responsibilities: Social UX Instructor | UX&UI Design | QA*

  


B.Tech in Production Engineering, MFA in Digital Cinema Harsha started his career in educational product design and then transitioned to UI/UX design. He is an ardent believer in collective genius and this let him to join the blockchain revolution. After having understood SDA's goals, he joined in their mission to reconfigure web3 UX and unlock the highest potential of human collaboration. He has been a part of the Cardano ecosystem for 2+ years and is a part of DAOs Love Cardano CT team for F9.

Linkedin

  


Beck Kanno - Frontend Design/Development

*Responsibilities: UX&UI Design | Conversational Modules | QA*

UX Designer and Frontend Web Development with knowledge in React and TailwindCSS frameworks, Figma, InVision and AdobeXD. He's currently exploring 3D graphics with Blender and curious about Web3 applications with his current skillset.

Portfolio1 | Porfolio2 | Linkedin.

  


Quasar / Deryck Lance

*Responsibilities: Butterfly / Partner Coordination / QA*

Cross -pollinator, connector of all things. Heart of gold.

Linkedin

  


Community members / Social design layers

Because we combine learning and doing, our live classes give us access to unique cognitive diversity which results in great design research. We piloted five live classes within three weeks (May/June 22)', and 34 people attended. In this short period, Social design / Live classes are already proving to be effective and people are curious, with the need for active promotion.

  


Proof in our RSVP channel

See levels of participation in our Gitbook (WIP).

  


Partner network

* Konma
* Littlefish
* Blockchain Learning Center
extra_fields.timeline_and_key_milestones:
UX 3.0 is new and not well addressed, our focus on distributed software design from the user experience perspective is unique. Our design tools are a consolidation of over 2 years of design research, and our live-classes combine learning, building and research using real world use cases.

  


We want to point out that the live-classes during the Launch Social Design Academy phase (Sept-Feb '22) are to educate the new materials, but also are used to tune the instructional materials or copy. We want to use Sept-Feb to put a solid foundation in place. Niels is closing out F6-Inwallet Onboarding for ADAholders, so that project is finished when results of F9 come in.

  


Our Products and Services are unique and self-developed, we will introduce new design tools for the web3 space Sept-feb '23. By connecting communities around design for blockchain, we create a force for good.

  


Our pilots in May/June and presentation about our Live-classes (Event burned on Cardano chain) showed that people are really interest in a meaningful new learning environments. People know it's important to decentralize, and participation of just a few tryout is encouraging, as we did no active promotion at all for 34 participants.

  


APPROACH IN STAGES

We set up seven stages to launch the Social Design Academy.

Check our SDA Budget/Roadmap spreadsheet for a concise, more visual overview.

==========

Stage A & B - Workshop & Instructional material production

Deliverables: Social UX/R&D Toolkit & Conversational Interaction Design workshop

Stakeholder: SDA-crew, Live-class attendants

Period: 2 Months, Sept-Okt '22

Budget: 308 hours 

  


Workflow:

1. Consolidate Materials in Abstract Version control
2. Social proofreading / Copy corrections
3. Visual Design / Brand Alignment & Instructional Worksheet Design
4. Export visuals and bring them to Miro
5. Create a placeholder page on our website

  


Key Milestone Sept '22

A2 - Activity Pairs & Activity Packs

A6 - Visual Governance Mapping

B5 - Module Production Template

  


==========

Stage C - Design Culture

  


Stakeholders: SDA-crew, Partner communities, External Brand (Strech goal)

Work Category: Workshop Design / Instructional Material Design

Period: Oct 22'

Budget: 60 hours

  


Workflow:

1. Consolidate Materials in Abstract Version control
2. Social proofreading / Copy corrections
3. Visual Design / Brand Alignment & Worksheet Design
4. Export visuals and bring them to Miro
5. Create a placeholder page on our website

proposal_relevant_experience: Founder Social Design Academy [Website] 24 yr. UX/UI [Li], Instructional Designer & Digital Governance Innovator. Funded F6: In-wallet Onboarding for ADAholders; Combining utility, education, and hospitality in a chat-like interface, making Cardano ready for family and friends
proposal_solution: We co-design UX 3.0 with Communities & Brands. We are evolving software designers into change makers by building Digital Story-based Chat Assistants for personal and collective development goals.
proposal_summary: DAOs & Brands continue to focus on functional product & service delivery, it's important, but 61% of customers [1] are seeking more personal and collective benefits to enhance their wellbeing.
